intro: Arachnothryx lojensis, commonly known as the Loja arachnothryx, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
